title: #224a: ALIEN HEART
author: Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page /
filename: 224 - Alien Heart - Dalek Soul - Stephen Cole & Guy Adams_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
1. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
FADE UP HUM OF TARDIS IN FLIGHT. FOOTSTEPS AS NYSSA ENTERS
Ah, Nyssa! You’ve woken just in time. We’re ready to land.
On Felkanto?
Yes. We’re dropping in during the twenty-first time frame, before the coal lakes became a tourist trap, so I think you’1l enjoy— [our visit]
FX: WILD TURBULENCE. TARDIS OUT OF CONTROL
Doctor?!!
(TRYING TO CONTROL TARDIS) Landing aborted! There’s a spatio- temporal anomaly where Felkanto ought to be. The TARDIS doesn’t like it.
I can tell!
Nyssa, check the co-ordinates!
They don’t make any sense. They’re changing, all the time.
What? Let me see. (MOVES ROUND - ALARMED) This is serious. Without a constant we can’t compute a way out.
Then what do we do?
Hold on and try to ride out the shockwaves.
Trans-dimensional shockwaves?
(GASPS AS TARDIS LURCHES) So it seems. The repercussions of some catastrophic event that’s disrupted time as well as space!!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 3
2. INT. SPACESHIP CONTROL ROOM (IN FLIGHT
SNOOZING
Captain Sonderal?
(DROWSY) Hmm...?
We’re in range of the Traxana System.
Thank you, Elthar. (YAWNS) These trans-Empire flights play havoc with my body clock.
Know the feeling, Captain. Although, technically not trans- Empire any longer.
This is Earth space. Even if the billions down on Traxana don’t know it.
Guild of Adjudicators might not agree, Captain.
You’re insubordinate, Elthar. What are you, Technical Sergeant, Grade Two?
Yes, Captain Sonderal.
I don’t suppose you’re smart enough to know better. Plot a course for the outpost.
Consider that within my capabilities, Captain.
FX: PROGRAMMING BLEEPS AND RISE IN ENGINE TONE
(WEARY) Why were you assigned to a mission like this?
Most likely because I’m more expendable than a grade one Technical Sergeant.
What does that say about me? (BEAT) Take us down.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 4
3. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM (IN FLIGHT
FX: TURBULENCE
Nyssa! The co-ordinates, what do they read now?
Still shifting, but within a smaller range...
Right! I’m going to attempt a rematerialisation.
But what about the anomaly you detected? If we materialise ina zone of unstable matter, the TARDIS could be destroyed.
If we don’t, we’ll be torn apart by these aftershocks! Hold on!
FX: TARDIS MATERIALISATION NOISE FADES INTO HOVER MODE
(EXHAUSTED) Co-ordinates stable. We’re out of danger!
And Felkanto?
(PAUSE) It’s not there. Felkanto has... gone!
Let me see. (HE CROSSES TO JOIN HERE) Not a trace. An entire planet, a population of billions...
Could it be an effect of the same entropy release that destroyed Traken?
Impossible. (FX: SWITCH, CONTROLS) Felkanto hasn’t only been destroyed, it’s been eradicated from the temporal fabric of the universe.
It never existed? How is that possible?
I don’t know. (FX: SCANNER SCREEN) Look. Seems it’s not only Felkanto.
What am I looking at — a long-range scan?
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 5

Yes, along the wavelength of the anomalous particles. In this constellation alone, unstable matter is all that’s left of ten worlds. Varga, Ottonius, Hastus Major... All of them erased within the last thirty years, relative time.
What about that planet in the last system? Anomalous particles registering... but in nothing like the same concentrations.
Good old Traxana, still standing! Or more accurately, still spinning through space at a thousand miles per hour. Let’s take a closer look... (FX: SWITCHES) That can’t be right.
What? It’s just an outpost of some sort on Traxana’s moon, lene: Ge?
The people of Traxana don’t have space travel. As yet, they haven’t set foot upon their moon.
Then... that base is alien in origin?
Yes. I rather think we should pay it a visit. (FX: DEMATERIALISATION INITIATED) Don’t you?
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 6
4. INT. TRAXANA MOONBASE — CORRIDOR
(FX: TARDIS MATERIALISES. BACKGROUND WHOOSH OF MOONBASE SYSTEMS. OUTER DOORS CREAK OPEN. )
Here we are. The mysterious moonbase.

Doesn’t look very mysterious from here. Uniform walls and floor panels for swift assembly. Electro-luminescent cells in the ceiling for light. The doors and controls look like they’re meant for humanoids.
Or just plain humans. (SIGHS) Traxana lies a few trillion miles beyond the frontier of Earth’s Empire — and yet this base is built to a standard Earth military design.
A forward base, built by humans from Tegan’s future?

Oh, hundreds of years in her future, yes. A forward base designed to support tactical military operations. Something of a coincidence that the trail of anomalous particles would seem to end here, hmm? Or begin here.
You believe human beings destroyed those planets?
Testing out some new and terrible weapon to further expand their empire? It wouldn’t be the first time. (HE SETS OFF) Come on, let’s find the control room and announce our presence. Loudly.
(FX: CREEPY ALIEN SKITTERING NOISE GROWING CLOSER; CELL-SPIDER LEGS TAPPING METAL FLOORS)
Doctor, wait! Do you hear that?
(PAUSE) Something’s coming.
It doesn’t sound human.
A security system of some kind? (BEAT) Nyssa, get back to the TARDIS. I came here to confront whoever’s in charge. If that means allowing myself to be captured by—
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 7
FX: CHITTERING CELL-SPIDERS TAKE THE CORNER
(REACTS) Doctor!!!
— by a swarm of giant green arachnoids...? (CALLS) How do you do? I’m the Doctor.
There are hundreds of them. And they’re not stopping!
Perhaps they’re not in charge. Hmm, one could easily get carried away on the tide of those things. Quickly, into that alcove!
FX: THEY JUMP ASIDE AS THE MASS OF CELL-SPIDERS RUSH PAST
(QUIET) Their bodies... They’re almost like cells, magnified and misshapen. (THINKS OF A NAME FOR THEM) ‘Cell-spiders’, you might call them.
(QUIET) Creatures native to this moon? Hmm. Fortunately, it seems they’re not interested in us— (HE IS YANKED FORWARD) Whoops!
Doctor! Come back!
(GASP OF EFFORT, FALLS BACK) I’m all right.
What happened, did that cell-spider grab you?
Not deliberately. That jelly-like substance they’re coated in forms a powerful adhesive. My coat stuck to it, dragged me along. So keep back, Nyssa, don’t let them— [touch you]
(FX: NYSSA SCREAMS AND THE SOUND PANS AND FADES QUICKLY TO SHOW SHE’S SNATCHED AWAY BY THE CELL-SPIDERS )
— touch you. (SHOUTS) Nyssa!
(YELLING) Doctor, it’s got me too!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 8
(SHOUTS) Don’t struggle now, you’ll be trampled. I’m coming after you!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 9
5. INT. MOONBASE CORRIDOR INTO CONTROL ROOM
(NYSSA IS CLINGING TO THE CELL-SPIDER AS IT RACES AFTER ITS FELLOWS )
Please... whatever you are, stop, so I can free myself. (SHOUTS) Doctor? I don’t think the cell-spiders are running mindlessly. They’re taking a particular course through this base.
FX: DOOR HUMS OPEN. A TRANSMAT MACHINE IS OPERATING
<HIDEOUS SCREECH>
(SHOUTS) The cell-spiders have gathered in some kind of control room! There’s a machine here, I don’t know what it does. Some sort of transportation device...?
(FX: TRANSMAT SOUNDS REACH PEAK, NOISE OF NYSSA AND SPIDERS IS FADING AWAY )
(DESPERATE) Doctor, they’re taking me with them!!!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 10
6. INT. MOONBASE CORRIDOR
FX: DOORS OPEN
SONDERAL AND ELTHAR WALK ALONG
Elthar, these monitoring outposts are self-cleaning and self- repairing, am I right?
Right, Captain.
So what’s that smell? It’s been getting stronger all the way from the landing bay.
ELTHAR PAUSES, STOOPS
Ugh, it’s this. A kind of slime on the floor. Sticky.
It looks organic.
There’s a whole trail of it.
Another trail to follow, huh?
(FX: DISTANT SMALL EXPLOSION AND WHINE OF A GENERATOR RUNNING DOWN)
What was that?
It came from the control room. Draw your weapon and reconnoitre. See who the hell is in there.
FX: ELTHAR WALKS FORWARD AND DOUBLES BACK
It’s a man. Blond. Wearing the weirdest uniform. And, er, he seems to be sabotaging a big chunk of the control room.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page I]
7. INT. MOONBASE CONTROL ROOM
(DOCTOR IS WORKING AT CONTROLS. SONDERAL AND ELTHAR BURST INTO THE CONTROL ROOM TO CONFRONT HIM)
You. Whatever it is you’re doing, stop.
(BRISK, WORKING ON) Pardon my rewiring of your system controls. My friend was taken from here just a few minutes ago and I must get after her. I can’t let you [stop me. ]
Stop it, whoever the hell you are.
I’m the Doctor.
Hands in the air.
Would you settle for one hand in the air while I finish this little job?
Both hands! I’m Captain Sonderal, Intelligence Corps investigation unit, Trans-Solar Rim, and you have just three seconds to step away from those controls.
(LOWER) Captain, what are those controls? They’re not standard
base issue.
Not now, Elthar. One... Two...
(HITS BUTTON) Three!
FX: HOWLING ULTRASONIC FREQUENCY EFFECT
SONDERAL & ELTHAR: [GASPS, YELLS, AGONY]
FX: FREQUENCY EFFECT POWERS DOWN
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 12

Are you all right? I had a feeling that someone might object to my being here, so I’ve upgraded the intercom system to carry ultra-high frequencies as a defensive measure. I’m afraid I’1l have to switch on again unless you put down your guns and raise your hands. Is that the right way round? I’m normally on the other end of such negotiations.
RECOVERING) Play along, Elthar. Weapons down. (FX: DROP GUNS
All right, “Doctor” - what are you doing here?
Just the question I’d like to put to you. You’ve installed this outpost on a planetary system outside of Earth’s empire, I’m guessing without consent.
That’s right. The Traxanans have barely reached the space age, they’re not ready for first contact with alien civilisations.

(ANGER RISING) This outpost marks the end point of a trail of obliterated worlds. Untold numbers of living creatures, gone. Unique and intricate histories and ecosystems, undone. Freedoms fought for, loves, hates and sacrifices, wiped from the fabric of the universe by some monstrous, degenerate weapon.
Now hold on.
A weapon known as the human race?
We're here investigating the disappearance of those same planets. No one has claimed responsibility.
What about the creatures here? Glutinous green multipeds.
What?
My companion called them cell-spiders.
(REALISES) That slime we saw, the stink round here...
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 13
The cell-spiders left this outpost by transmat beam, and took my friend with them. I need to know where they went, and I'd like to know why, but the system’s deadlocked.
Transmat — you mean, a matter transmitter?
Of course!

We don’t know anything about “cell-spiders”, or where your “friend” might have gone. There are thousands of covert monitoring stations, built on the fringes of Earth’s empire to guard against possible space invasion. None of them are fitted with transmat beams.
If they were, d’you think we’d have come here by beta dart?
How did you get here, anyway? We saw no sign of a spaceship.
My friend and I parked our conveyance... er, discreetly. I have to find her.
I should warn you, Doctor...
And I should remind you, I have a dangerous intercom at my disposal.
You’re an intruder on Empire property!
And your empire is trespassing on a world over which it has no dominion. Stalemate, I’d say. How about a truce?
A temporary truce.
And a pooling of information. But first we must find Nyssa. Elthar — Tech Sergeant Elthar, was it? — you’1ll know the systems here, that should speed the work along.
You’re telling the truth, then? About these cell-spiders?
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 14
Who’ve built a transmat and come and go as they please?
Indeed. You came here in secret and installed your own technology. Now it seems that another force has done the same.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 15
8. INT. MINE PASSAGE ON TRAXANA
(FX: DANK, DRIPPING TUNNEL IN UNDERGROUND MINE. A SOFT INSISTENT BEEPING IN THE DISTANCE LINGERS TO END OF SCENE.
NYSSA STIRS FROM UNCONSCIOUSNESS, THEEBE WATCHES
(GROGGY) It’s so dark. I’m underground. Doctor?
You don’t need a doctor, girl. You’ve got a lump on your head, that’s all, nothing to cry about.
Who are you? (WINCES) Why are you pointing a gun at me.
My name is Theebe Bostopol. I’m pointing a gun at you because you got through two dozen security devices to trespass on my property, and I don’t know what else you’re capable of.
My name is Nyssa. I don’t mean you any harm.
(SCOFFS) Sure. And there was me thinking you were releasing another bunch of those glowing spider things into my mine.
I was brought here, to your mine, by those creatures.
They already got rid of the last of my workers. I suppose you’re wanting the biggest lucanol deposits on Traxana for yourself, are you?

I’m on Traxana? (WINCES AGAIN) My head — I must’ve hit it on the rockfall there, it knocked me loose. The cell-spiders’ skin secretes a sticky paste, you see, perhaps to help them cling to sheer surfaces.
Your know-how only confirms it: you’ve got to be the one dumping those things here.
No. The spiders were sent here over a transmat beam from the outpost on your moon.
The what now?
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 16
(MUTTERS) Of course, Traxana doesn’t have space travel, you won’t know about the humans and their base...
(IMPATIENT) What are you babbling about? I’ve had enough. Get up! Slowly.
FX: NYSSA GETS TO HER FEET. SHE HEARS THE BEEPING
What’s that noise?
My heat trace scanner. I left it back along the tunnel. I only found you down here because I was hunting those bugs. (BEAT) How did you breed them? There’s nothing like them anywhere else on Traxana.
And you say the creatures drove away your workers?
I said they got rid of them. For good.
They kill?

Doesn’t everything? (PAUSE) Those monsters have infested the lowest levels. The mine’s on shutdown, I’m losing a ton of money every day. I need to catch me a big spider to haul out to the surface, to show the world just what’s happened here - so I can get compensation.
For the families of the miners who died?
Sure. Them too.
Well, I understand your motives. But not very much else. (SIGHS) I must find a way back to the Doctor.
I told you, there’s nothing wrong with you. It’s those spiders you have to find.
If your scanner could be made to work more efficiently, perhaps I can help you. (PAUSE, MORE QUIETLY) And myself too.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 17
9. INT. MOONBASE CONTROL ROOM
FX: OVER CONTROL ROOM HUM, THE BUZZ OF TOOLS
Aha! There, you see, Tech Sergeant Elthar? I’ve reverse- engineered a destination log from the transmat’s transponder memory.
Clever.
It’ll take some time to auto-compile, then we’1ll know where Nyssa is. (BEAT) Haven’t you managed to reactivate the transmat terminal yet?
No, I haven’t. (BEAT) If you go chasing off after your friend, Captain Sonderal will not be impressed.
Where is she?
Scouting for these cell-spiders of yours.
That could be dangerous. Here, let me see what you’re doing.
Be my guest. (SIGHS) Have you seen the number of logic codes and restraints wired in? Its Earth tech, but the way it’s been put together...
Yes. Ingenious, and extremely devious. Here, give me the probe. Have you tried ...?
FX: PROBE WHIRR, THEN BRIGHT BEEP
I had not, Doctor!
(FX: PROBE WHIRR, FURTHER BLEEPS AS HE AND DOCTOR WORK AS THEY TALK)
Why not let me handle the fission bank dislocation, hmm? (HE STARTS WORK)
Doctor, if you’re not responsible for this trail of devastated planets, why are you here?
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 18
As a concerned citizen of the universe.
You must work for somebody.
Actually, no. (FX: WORKS ON) Now, your employers — Empire Military — they detected the tempo-spatial butchering of a whole string of planets, but only sent two people to investigate?
No-one claimed responsibility, no-one issued threats or
warnings. It’s been happening for thirty years outside of
Empire... and the military’s hard-stretched. This expedition was
only authorised as a science mission after Felkanto went down — it’s barely a light year from Empire space. But until we find
hard evidence there’s a danger to humanity...
They’re not interested. Typical blinkered attitude.
We came here to scan for that evidence.

But instead, you found it going on around you. (BEAT) See here, on the probe screen. The power requirements have been calibrated so that they draw and store the necessary power without disrupting normal outpost operations...
Because if they did, alarms go off and Empire sends warships.
So! Whoever’s built the transmat is keen to maintain a low profile. Something tells me your Captain Sonderal isn’t going to find these creatures unless they want her to.
If they’re responsible for the destruction we’ve seen, they have full-on powers. Why bother to hide at all?
Perhaps those powers can’t be employed without a period of preparation... What’s worrying me is, the energy to power this transmat wouldn’t trigger an alarm on its own.
Then... your calculating aliens are using the energy to power something else?
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL)
Yes. I wonder what.
(FX: SONDERAL COMES RUSHING IN, OUT
Elthar, with me.
Captain.
Please, can’t it wait just a minute
to re-priming the transmat.
Page 19
OF BREATH)
or two longer? We’re close
So you can go after your friend? I think you’1ll want to see this before you trust alien technology. Move!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 20
10. MINE TUNNEL — TRAXANA
NYSSA AND THEEBE ARE MOVING THROUGH THE TUNNELS
Nyssa, keep moving. (PAUSE) What are you looking at?
These tunnels, they’re all so different.
You wouldn’t expect them to be the same, would you?
I mean, the rock itself. There are long stalactites of lucanol here, but in the last passage their formation looks to have only just begun.
So what? I saw a stretch of molten lava way below me nearer the entrance.
One you’d never seen before?
It’s just tectonics. The rock grinds together on the equator here. Young rock, old rock, who cares as long as it keeps turning out the lucanol. Now, no more sightseeing. Keep moving.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 21
11. MOONBASE CORRIDOR
SONDERAL, ELTHAR AND THE DOCTOR STRIDE ALONG THE CORRIDOR
What is it you think you’ve found, Captain Sonderal?
More of that slime?
No, Elthar. (STOPS STRIDING) Just this section of the corridor.
(SURVEYS) Fascinating.
Dust is fascinating?
The thickness of it. The cell-spiders came this way when Nyssa was taken, and yet it’s lying undisturbed... as if for thousands of years. And look, the sealant in the windows there.
Crumbling.
That sealant is meant to last for millennia. It’s decayed.
But the areas of the corridor around this stretch are untouched.
Another spatio-temporal anomaly.
What could cause this?
If I were you, I’d scan local space for anomalous activity. That is what you came here to do, isn’t it?
He’s right, Captain.
Then get back to the control room, Elthar, and do it.
Very good, Captain.
FX: ELTHAR EXITS
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 22
I’1ll go with him. I must follow Nyssa, find out where the cell- Spiders went, what they’re being used for — and after seeing this corridor, just what they’re capable of.
Doctor, wait. You’re the only one who’s actually witnessed these spiders. Show me where you first saw them. Perhaps we can track them to their entry point.
Captain, there’s no time to roam this base whistling for the Spiders to come out. (SIGHS) I have more sophisticated equipment on the TARDIS.
Your discreetly parked “conveyance”?
It’s this way. Through the dust. Better tread lightly — I’d say the floor has aged several million years. Although it’s our own time I’m worried about.
What do you mean?
I rather think it’s running out.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 23
12. EXT. OUTSIDE THE MINE, TRAXANA
FX: AN ALIEN PASTORAL SCENE, SPACE-CICADAS AND SO ON.
Here on the surface, your heat trace scanner should prove more effective, Theebe. (BEAT) Are your tools stored in that out- building?
Some of them. (SUSPICIOUS) Look, the signal was bad enough underground, how can it be better out here in broad daylight?
Proximity to raw lucanol affects electrical equipment. (BEAT) Surely that discovery has been made on Traxana?
Nyssa, I told you I don’t believe all this I’m-from-outer-space nonsense! Just switch on the machine.
Very well.
FX: NYSSA SWITCHES ON MACHINE. STEADY THRUM OF SIGNAL
It really works? Wait. Those glowing blobs on the screen, they’re spiders?
Each one represents a nest. There could be hundreds of cell- Spiders in each.
So I got... (COUNTING) seven nests in the bottom of the mine?
According to the scan, the deepest passages extend at least a mile below ground. But their distribution through the mine is so regular. They’ve either been drawn to a spot — or sent there.
By you.
I told you, I have nothing to do with them. What about the location of the mine, could that be significant? You said we’re on the equator.
Nice and remote from all those highland cities.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 24
Perhaps the creatures are drawn along lines of magnetic force? (BEAT) I wish the Doctor were here.
(SNORTS) I’m guessing he’s a head doctor.
He’s a Doctor of most things, and he’1ll want to help you, I’m sure. Right now, he’ll be trying to find me. (QUIET) So I’d best give him some help.
What’d you say?
. just that if I’m to give you some help, I’1l need those tools I mentioned. To scan on other wavelengths and boost the signal to get a more precise picture of the cell-spiders’ location.
Can you do that?
It’s your machine, don’t you know?
My.. ‘business partner’ took care of that stuff. Till the Spiders took care of her.
I’m sorry.
If you don’t help me out you will be. Well, there are tools in the work hut there. (FX: OPENS HUT DOORS) And... look at what else there is. A whole lot of mining explosive. (LOW) Just what I need.
Before I reconfigure the circuits, I’1ll check the basic signal strength.
FX: BLEEPS
What are those icons at the side of the screen?
I think they make up the index file. As for which wavelengths each stands for I suppose we just press each in turn and see...
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 25
(FX: SOFT BEEPS AS SHE PRESSES, UNTIL A FAINT, SINISTER STATICKY HEARTBEAT SOUND CAN BE HEARD: THE DALEK CONTROL ROOM HEARTBEAT, GRUNGED UP SO NOT YET RECOGNISABLE)
What IS that?
Subsonic wavelength. Strange. It sounds like a heartbeat.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 26
13. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
FX: TARDIS DOORS. DOCTOR AND SONDERAL ENTER.
Welcome aboard the TARDIS, Captain Sonderal.
FX: DOORS CLOSE
(SHAKEN) To insanity in a box. All this space inside. Does... does it bury itself upon landing?
(DISTRACTED, WORKING CONTROLS) No. It’s simply bigger on the... [TRAILS OFF] I wonder if that’s what we’re up against.
A force that’s buried itself beneath the moonbase after landing, allowing the cell-spiders discreet entry?
Or a force with a time and space machine like mine.
Time and space?
That corridor had aged millions of years — localised temporal spillage from a damaged space-time drive could explain it.

Assuming such a thing is possible, could it also have destroyed all those planets - as some sort of side-effect rather than a weapon? I mean, there’s no strategic sense in oblitering those worlds. No one has come forward to take responsibility...
Ten worlds is a lot of accidents. (BEAT) Let’s see if we can find its energy trace.
FX: AS IN ‘THE VISITATION’, SCANNING CONTROLS GIVE WAY TO:
(FX: SAME DISTORTED HEARTBEAT EFFECT OVER TARDIS SPEAKERS — AGAIN, NOT RECOGNISABLE )
What’s that?
Advanced technology, located at the northern perimeter of this base.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 27
You’ve found them? Well, how many are there?
I don’t know.
How many weapons do you have on board?
Including intelligence, experience and formidable negotiation skills?
No.
None.
Unbelievable. I’1l have to signal Empire for back-up. (FX: COMMS BUZZ) That’s Elthar on comms. (FX: WORKS COMMS) Sonderal.
(COMMS) Captain, I’ve scanned local space, and detected a concentration of those anomalous particles.
Where?
(COMMS) On Traxana. Population, five billion. And going by your reverse-engineered destination log, Doctor... your friend’s one of them.
Nyssa...!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 28
14. INT. MOONBASE CONTROL ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
DIRECT CONTINUATION OF SCENE 13 BUT NOW FROM ELTHAR’S POV

The log records one hundred and eighty seven matter transmissions to different underground points across Traxana’s equator in the last year, the last ten all within a fifty-mile radius. But I’m picking up a faint signal on infra-red wavebands from the site your friend was sent to.
(COMMS) And the transmat’s functioning?
It is.
Splendid! You can expect us shortly.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 29
15. INT. TRAXANA UNDERGROUND MINE PASSAGE
FX: NYSSA AND THEEBE MOVING ALONG WITH SCANNER
Come on, Nyssa, move faster. It didn’t take you long to boost the scanner signal. A couple of packs of mining explosive shouldn’t slow you down this much.
I’m not in a hurry to blow myself up.
I showed you, they have to be primed first. (FX: SHAKES SCANNER) How come the scanner’s not showing the spider nests any more?
(LYING) It’s... on a deep search cycle, Theebe. They’1l show soon.
And then...

Please, won’t you think again about this plan? Delivering high- explosives into the lowest levels and detonating them might not destroy the spider nests, but it will damage the structural integrity of your mine.
It’ll bury those things alive. There’re plenty of seams near the surface. You can see from the glow around you.
(STOPS WALKING) I’m sure we came this way before, and the lucanol was mined out. How can a mineral reform?
You’re crazy.
I’m certain we were here. It’s as if the physical landscape is being affected by some form of time spillage...
(SPLUTTERS) You can’t spill time like it’s water!
I don’t mean it that way. These spider-creatures are alien, Theebe, you don’t know what they can do!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 30
And neither do you, or so you keep telling me. If the spiders are responsible — well, then: it’s good we’re gonna bury them, right?
(SIGHS) Where are we going, exactly?

THEEBE: If you don’t help me out you will be. Well, there are tools in the work hut there. (FX: OPENS HUT DOORS) And... look at what else there is. A whole lot of mining explosive. (LOW) Just what I need.
NYSSA: Before I reconfigure the circuits, I’1ll check the basic signal strength.
THEEBE: What are those icons at the side of the screen?
NYSSA: I think they make up the index file. As for which wavelengths each stands for I suppose we just press each in turn and see...
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 25
NYSSA: (FX: SOFT BEEPS AS SHE PRESSES, UNTIL A FAINT, SINISTER STATICKY HEARTBEAT SOUND CAN BE HEARD: THE DALEK CONTROL ROOM HEARTBEAT, GRUNGED UP SO NOT YET RECOGNISABLE)
THEEBE: What IS that?
NYSSA: Subsonic wavelength. Strange. It sounds like a heartbeat.
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 26
DOCTOR: Welcome aboard the TARDIS, Captain Sonderal.
SONDERAL: (SHAKEN) To insanity in a box. All this space inside. Does... does it bury itself upon landing?
DOCTOR: (DISTRACTED, WORKING CONTROLS) No. It’s simply bigger on the... [TRAILS OFF] I wonder if that’s what we’re up against.
SONDERAL: A force that’s buried itself beneath the moonbase after landing, allowing the cell-spiders discreet entry?
DOCTOR: Or a force with a time and space machine like mine.
SONDERAL: Time and space?
DOCTOR: That corridor had aged millions of years — localised temporal spillage from a damaged space-time drive could explain it.
SONDERAL: Assuming such a thing is possible, could it also have destroyed all those planets - as some sort of side-effect rather than a weapon? I mean, there’s no strategic sense in oblitering those worlds. No one has come forward to take responsibility...
DOCTOR: Ten worlds is a lot of accidents. (BEAT) Let’s see if we can find its energy trace.
DOCTOR: (FX: SAME DISTORTED HEARTBEAT EFFECT OVER TARDIS SPEAKERS — AGAIN, NOT RECOGNISABLE )
SONDERAL: What’s that?
DOCTOR: Advanced technology, located at the northern perimeter of this base.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 27
SONDERAL: You’ve found them? Well, how many are there?
DOCTOR: I don’t know.
SONDERAL: How many weapons do you have on board?
DOCTOR: Including intelligence, experience and formidable negotiation skills?
SONDERAL: No.
DOCTOR: None.
SONDERAL: Unbelievable. I’1l have to signal Empire for back-up. (FX: COMMS BUZZ) That’s Elthar on comms. (FX: WORKS COMMS) Sonderal.
ELTHAR: (COMMS) Captain, I’ve scanned local space, and detected a concentration of those anomalous particles.
DOCTOR: Where?
ELTHAR: (COMMS) On Traxana. Population, five billion. And going by your reverse-engineered destination log, Doctor... your friend’s one of them.
DOCTOR: Nyssa...!
CROSS TO: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 28
ELTHAR: The log records one hundred and eighty seven matter transmissions to different underground points across Traxana’s equator in the last year, the last ten all within a fifty-mile radius. But I’m picking up a faint signal on infra-red wavebands from the site your friend was sent to.
DOCTOR: (COMMS) And the transmat’s functioning?
ELTHAR: It is.
DOCTOR: Splendid! You can expect us shortly.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 29
THEEBE: Come on, Nyssa, move faster. It didn’t take you long to boost the scanner signal. A couple of packs of mining explosive shouldn’t slow you down this much.
NYSSA: I’m not in a hurry to blow myself up.
THEEBE: I showed you, they have to be primed first. (FX: SHAKES SCANNER) How come the scanner’s not showing the spider nests any more?
NYSSA: (LYING) It’s... on a deep search cycle, Theebe. They’1l show soon.
THEEBE: And then...
NYSSA: Please, won’t you think again about this plan? Delivering high- explosives into the lowest levels and detonating them might not destroy the spider nests, but it will damage the structural integrity of your mine.
THEEBE: It’ll bury those things alive. There’re plenty of seams near the surface. You can see from the glow around you.
NYSSA: (STOPS WALKING) I’m sure we came this way before, and the lucanol was mined out. How can a mineral reform?
THEEBE: You’re crazy.
NYSSA: I’m certain we were here. It’s as if the physical landscape is being affected by some form of time spillage...
THEEBE: (SPLUTTERS) You can’t spill time like it’s water!
NYSSA: I don’t mean it that way. These spider-creatures are alien, Theebe, you don’t know what they can do!
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 30
THEEBE: And neither do you, or so you keep telling me. If the spiders are responsible — well, then: it’s good we’re gonna bury them, right?
NYSSA: (SIGHS) Where are we going, exactly?
THEEBE: Back to where I found you first. There’s a shaft close by that runs straight down for half-a-mile. Down go the blasting packs. Boom.
NYSSA: All right. But what if, then... up come the spiders??
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 31
DOCTOR: Right, Captain Sonderal. I’ve got a fix on Nyssa’s location at last, it’s high time I went after her.
DOCTOR: (FX: TARDIS DOORS OPEN. DOCTOR MAKES TO GO, BUT THERE’S A WARNING BUZZ FROM THE CONSOLE — OVER ‘HEARTBEAT’, NOW GOING FASTER)
SONDERAL: What’s that?
DOCTOR: Wait... (ALARM) The scanners show a massive spike in the alien power demand. They’re operating something. Raise Elthar.
SONDERAL: Elthar.
ELTHAR: (COMMS) Here, Captain.
DOCTOR: Elthar, something’s drawing on the outpost’s energy systems. Can you shut down the power?
ELTHAR: (COMMS) I can try... No. No, the controls won’t respond.
ELTHAR: (FX: THROUGH THE TARDIS OPEN DOORS WE HEAR THE SKITTERING OF APPROACHING SPIDERS)
DOCTOR: Oh, no.
SONDERAL: Cell-spiders!
SONDERAL: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 32
NYSSA: I have to rest, Theebe. These blast packs, they’re so heavy.
THEEBE: You really are dainty, aren’t you? You can rest in a moment. It’s coming up just ahead — the place where I found you with those beloved bugs of yours.
NYSSA: What were you even doing down here? You had no equipment.
THEEBE: Well, I got plenty now, don’t I? Watch out for the rockfall, we don’t want you bumping those explosives the way you banged your head right?
NYSSA: There is no rockfall.
THEEBE: What?
NYSSA: Look, it’s gone. As if time has unwound here. Theebe, something the spiders brought with them has affected... Wait, what’s that? Where the rockfall was.
THEEBE: Nothing. Come on—
NYSSA: It’s a body. Someone’s hurt. (SHE HURRIES FORWARD)
THEEBE: Stay away from that.
NYSSA: It’s a woman. She must’ve been buried under the rockfall before... (BEAT) She’s dead. Shot in the chest.
THEEBE: (CALM) That’s right.
NYSSA: You knew?
THEEBE: Yes. Because I did it.
THEEBE: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 33
THEEBE: 18a. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
SONDERAL: There are hundreds of them!
DOCTOR: Yes, it seems a fresh batch has spawned.
SONDERAL: To use the transmat? But it’s been disconnected.
DOCTOR: Give me the comms. (SNATCHES) Elthar! Get out of the control room!
ELTHAR: (COMMS) What?
DOCTOR: There’s a horde of cell-spiders coming your way.
SONDERAL: Doctor, your ship doors are open—!
DOCTOR: I know! — Red lever, there.
DOCTOR: (FX: SHE PULLS, DOORS START TO CLOSE BUT THEN STICK AS A GIANT CELL-SPIDER CREATURE — WHICH WILL PROVE TO BE THE SCION PRIME - BURSTS INTO THE TARDIS)
SONDERAL: (SHOUTS) Doctor - spider!!
DOCTOR: Oh no. It’s wedged in the doors!
SCION: [TERRIFYING HUNGRY SHRIEK AND STRAINING]
SONDERAL: My gun has no effect. That thing’s massive.
DOCTOR: Twice the size of the ones that took Nyssa.
SCION: [SHRIEK AND CLATTER OF PROBING LEGS]
SCION: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 34
DOCTOR: Sonderal, get back! It’s breaking in!!!
DOCTOR: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 35

elements.text: PART TWO
(SHOUTS) Doctor - spider!!
Oh no. It’s wedged in the doors!
FX: GUNFIRE
[TERRIFYING HUNGRY SHRIEK AND STRAINING ]
My gun has no effect. That thing’s massive.
Twice the size of the ones that took Nyssa.
[SHRIEK AND CLATTER OF PROBING LEGS ]
Sonderal, get back! It’s breaking in!!!
18b. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: TARDIS DOORS STRAIN ALARMINGLY
Elthar? Elthar, get over here. Follow this signal, we need backup.
(SNATCHES COMMS) No, give me that! Elthar — is there a self- destruct assembly for this outpost?
(COMMS) Yes, but you told me to get out.
Activate the self-destruct!
(COMMS) That’s crazy.
[HORRIFYING YOWL]
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 36
Do it! Now!!! Sonderal, tell him.
That’s an order, Elthar!
(COMMS) Understood.
Doctor, what the hell are you thinking, blow up the base—?
Wait.
FX: SCION RAILS AND ROARS THEN WITHDRAWS, CLATTERING
It.. it’s going. Leaving us alone. Why?
(FASCINATED) Like a hive queen set apart from the drones it controls. It does have intelligence.
That thing knows I ordered Elthar to destroy the control room?
And obviously considers that a priority over dealing with us. It still needs the control room — and the transmat.
So it’s gone to stop Elthar? We must warn him. (FX: COMMS) Elthar, abort self-destruct and get out, for real this time. Elthar?
FX: STATIC
Something’s blocking your communicator.
That’s too damned intelligent. Come on, we can reach him on the base intercom.
We can’t. Not since I rewired it to create the ultrasonic defence as you arrived. (FX: TARDIS DOOR OPENS) We’1l have to reach him the old fashioned way — Run!!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 37
19. INT. MINE PASSAGE ON TRAXANA
Theebe, what happened? Who was this woman?
She owned the mine - before I did.
You killed her for it?

Her and the rest of the syndicate. They flipped out when those Spiders started to appear, and some of the tunnels turned inside out. A couple of miners got killed — all heads and legs sticking out of the walls. She was going to tell the authorities, bring in investigators. Shut down the whole mine.
She wanted to act responsibly.
She always was stupid. I figured that if the spiders killed two of us, why couldn’t they kill the whole lot?
But the cell-spiders don’t kill with bullets.

Which is why I buried the evidence, just like you’re on your way down to do. We’1l blow up the lower levels, kill the Spiders, drag out a few of their sticky green corpses — that and those arms and legs and heads in the wall will be enough to convince the authorities that those critters killed everyone but me. So full control passes to the sole survivor, and I can sell out for a fortune the first chance I get.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 38
20. INT. MOONBASE CORRIDOR
(DOCTOR AND SONDERAL RUNNING ALONG CORRIDOR. THEY PAUSE, PANTING. DISTANT CHITTER OF SPIDERS IN CONTROL ROOM AHEAD)
Doctor... Listen! Sounds like...?
Cell-spiders. They’re in the control room.
(DISTANT) <AGONISED SCREAM>
And so is Elthar.
THEY RUN OFF AGAIN. AS THEY RUN:
FX: TRANSMAT NOISE. SPIDER CHITTERS/SCRAPES STOP
That’s the transmat in operation. The cell-spiders have
regained control.
And transported themselves?
Subterranean delivery one hundred and eighty-eight. Come on!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 39
21. INT. MOONBASE CONTROL ROOM
FX: DOORS OPEN. DOCTOR AND SONDERAL RUSH IN
FX: SCION MAKING LOW NOISES, MOTIONLESS, IN PAIN
(HORROR) Elthar..!! Oh, no. No.
Move carefully, Sonderal. That bloated cell-spider looks like the one from the TARDIS. Twice the size, twice the danger.
<WARNING CHITTER>
It can’t do anything — look, it’s trapped.
In the actual fabric of the wall. Like— [Elthar]
Like Elthar.
(STIRS, AGONY) Get... get out of here.
Elthatr...?
Let me see! There may be a way to save him.
Save him? Doctor, he’s sticking out of the wall!
(DEATH’S DOOR) The cell-spiders. Doctor, they reversed everything we did.
Another time shift.
The technology... put itself back together. I was knocked into the wall by those things as they piled into the transmission field... it was still in flux.
(UGH!) And it reformed around your body?
Causing a massive systems failure.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 40
In me as well as the transmat... (BEAT) Doctor?
Easy, Elthar.
I’m sorry the transmat’s bust now. Your... friend.
No way to reach Nyssa now. (SIGHS) The co-ordinates were lost in the rollback of time.
Wrong. Six-zero-eleven-five-epsilon-apple-two.
(HOPE!!) You remember?
Like... it’s a part of me. Six-zero-eleven-five-epsilon-apple- two, that was last location. Six-zero-eleven-five-epsilon- apple-two...
Well done, Tech-Sergeant Elthar. First class!
Nah... second class...
HE DIES
Peace hereafter, soldier.
<SPITEFUL HISS>
But no peace in the meantime. Stay well back from that oversized cell-spider, Sonderal. I’ve got to get this transmat working again!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 41
22. INT. MINE PASSAGE ON TRAXANA

Theebe, there’s so much more at stake than this mine. The cell- spiders came here by matter transporter from an outpost in Space. They have the power to cause spatial-temporal anomalies. The whole of Traxana is in danger.
You're insane, Nyssa. It’s obvious that you found those spiders someplace and started all this. So if I have to kill a mad woman in self-defence, well...
I’m not mad. I’m alien. You and I might look the same but we are different. (DISGUST) So very different.
(FX: WHIRR OF THE MATTER TRANSMITTER. FIRST WHISPERS OF CELL- SPIDER CHITTERING)
What’s that?
The matter transporter. I tried to tell you. More cell-spiders
are coming. You see? Scores of them, appearing out of nowhere!
A trick.
FX: TRANSMAT FADES AS SPIDER NOISE TAKES PROMINENCE
Press yourself flat against the wall.
They’re disgusting.
FX: THEEBE FIRES HER GUN
Bullets can’t stop them, you’1ll just draw their attention to us.
Use the explosives! Those things are sticky, you said — the blasting packs will stick to them.
No! We have to learn what it is they want!
NYSSA GOES AFTER THE CHITTERING SPIDERS
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 42
Nyssa, I’m not finished with you. Are you mad?! Come back here!!
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 43
23. INT. TRANSMAT CONTROL ROOM
FX: DOCTOR WORKS SOME CONTROLS.
Are you getting anywhere with the transmat?
Nowhere!! (FX: THUMP AS HE KICKS IT) The controls are frozen.
And kicking them doesn’t help?
They are frozen in time. Disengaged from the present.
(VENGEFUL) What about that giant spider thing? How come it’s still alive when Elthar is dead?
<SINISTER CHITTER>
Don’t provoke it. Trapped inside the superstructure, it must be dying. (PAUSE) But dying in whose name?
You said that thing was the controller?
Of the foot soldiers, yes. Directing the hive, but taking its orders from something else in turn... (PAUSE) Or its programming.
Programming? You think it’s a cyborg?
These creatures spawn very quickly, requiring large amounts of power in order to do so, yes?
I suppose so.

Perhaps some kind of clone-generation technique is employed. Creatures with pre-programmed minds which have the ability to affect the temporal motion of their environment, forward in time, or backward. (SIGHS) There’s something I’m missing.
(PAUSE) Nyssa?
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 44

Yes. Well, Nyssa is brilliant in the field of bioelectronics. (BEAT) Bioelectronic. That heartbeat sound we heard in the TARDIS. A living, thinking, self-supporting machine. I wonder... (BURSTS INTO FLIGHTY ACTION, WORKING CONTROLS ETC) Elthar was scanning local space, we can turn that scan inward easily enough.
I thought the controls were frozen in time?
Only the transmat, not the rest of the systems.
FX: THE DISGUISED HEARTBEAT SOUNDS THROUGH THE CONTROL ROOM
There it is. But heavily shielded. Let’s see if we can boost the signal strength. Flick those switches there, would you?
These?
Yes. It should start becoming clearer, now...
FX: FAMILIAR DALEK CONTROL ROOM EFFECT THUDS OUT
Why. Why are my worst suspicions always confirmed?
What is it?
The creatures behind this. My oldest enemies. Life’s oldest enemies.
FX: 2 DALEKS APPROACHING DOWN CORRIDOR OUTSIDE
Doctor, outside in the corridor——
DALEK #1: Do not move.
DALEK #2: You are our prisoners.
Daleks.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 45
24. TRAXANA MINE BESIDE CHASM
(FX: CELL-SPIDERS AS THEY SCUTTLE INTO CHASM. PULSE OF THEEBE’S SCANNER GETTING CLOSER AS SHE APPROACHES )
There they go. Down into the depths.
(BEHIND) They didn’t attack you?
No. You should be pleased. They went just where you wanted, down the deepest shaft in this mine. (PAUSE) Give me the scanner.
Mind those blasting packs.
Give it to me. (FX: CHANGE OF SCANNER PULSE) I want to know what’s drawing those creatures down there. Now I’ve boosted the power, it should show us a wider area.
What’s showing — tunnels?
Yes. A network of passages running for miles through the mantle.
But those weren’t there before. The geological survey would’ve shown them up.
Then the cell-spiders are burrowing animals.
Through solid rock?
We know they have a unique relationship with the local landscape. An arachnid knows how to build a web by instinct — perhaps these creatures follow similar genetic instructions.
What kind of a web are they making?
I don’t know. But look at the scanner. Their excavations trace the equatorial circumference of this world.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 46
What?

The mine is a convenient start point for the cell-spiders since it extends so deeply into Traxana’s crust. Now they’ve burrowed deeper still, until their tunnels connect all the way around the planet.
That’s impossible.
It’s incredible, but it’s fact. Don’t waste time asking how. What we need to know is why.
That’s what you need to know, not me. I just want them out of this mine. And since your blasting packs are primed to detonate on impact — you can take the quick way down.
THEEBE TRIES TO FORCE NYSSA OVER THE EDGE.
(GRAPPLING) Theebe, get off me!
No-one’s gonna miss you, are they? The space girl who knew too much.
Please, you don’t have to do this.
After all I’ve done..? This is nothing.
<SCREAMS AS SHE GOES OVER THE PRECIPICE>
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 47
25. INT. TRANSMAT CONTROL ROOM
(WHISPERS) Doctor, I know my history, I know about the Daleks. We’re dead, aren’t we?
Not yet, Sonderal.
DALEK #1: Be silent.
<AGGRESSIVE CHITTERS>
DALEK #1: The first of the Scion Primes is dying.
Scion Prime? You mean to say it’s a descendant of yours? Yes, of course, like the cell-spiders — formed from Dalek DNA.
DALEK #2: You are responsible for its condition.
No. Your pet multipeds did it while attempting to repair your secret transmat station.
Daleks invading an Earth Empire military outpost — that could be construed as an act of war.
DALEK #1: Alien frontiers mean nothing to the Daleks.
Except in so much as their bases offer you a place from which to aim your attacks in secret.
DALEK #2: Inspect the matter transmitter.
DALEK #1: I obey.
Attacks that removed whole planets from the fabric of the universe! Felkanto, Ottonius, all of them. You’re responsible for the slaughter and desecration of billions of lives!!
DALEK #2: Your views are unimportant.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 48
DALEK #1: Matter transmitter non-functional.
DALEK #2: The matter transmitter must be restored.

I couldn’t agree more. (BEAT) You know, I didn’t suspect your involvement, despite your striking at the fifth dimension as well as the fourth. Daleks kill with surgical precision — why would you seek to leave a thirty-year trail of anomalous vandalism behind you? To place blame on others?
DALEK #1: The destruction of the planets was not intentional.
What...?
DALEK #2: Do not advise him! He is a Movellan spy!
(ASIDE) Movellan?
(ASIDE) A robotic race, the Daleks’ archenemies for a time.
DALEK #1: For all time!
DALEK #1: All Movellans and their agents will be exterminated.
The Movellans left this sector of space almost a century ago — after crushing your forces.
DALEK #2: You lie. You seek to avert the final Dalek victory!
DALEK #1: We are ready to act. The process has been perfected.
What “process”?
DALEK #2: The matter transmitter must be restored. Exterminate the intruders.
Wait! We can help you. We’re humanoids with flexible digits fitted to the task, we’ll be faster than you.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 49
I’1l summon my technical team at once... on the intercom.
(WITH MEANING) Yes. Be sure to call them on full volume.
FX: THE SAME SONIC ONSLAUGHT FROM PART ONE
FX: TRAPPED SCION HOWLS
DALEK #1: Auditory circuits overloading.
DALEK #2: (AFFECTED) Ex-ter-min-ate!
Run, Sonderal!
(FX: AS DOCTOR AND SONDERAL RUN FROM ROOM — DALEK RAY GUN AND IMPACT. NOISE DIES AWAY)
DALEK #2: Intruders escaping! (SPEEDS AWAY) Pursuit mode engaged.
DALEK #1: I will restore the matter transmitter.
<WEAK CHITTERS>
DALEK #1: You have failed the Daleks. You have failed .. me. (PAUSE)
Exterminate.
FX: DEATH RAY. SCION DIES
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 50
26. INT. MOONBASE CORRIDOR
DOCTOR and SONDERAL sprint from DALEK 2
All right, Doctor, what now?
Back to the TARDIS.
DALEK #2: Halt! You will be exterminated.
FX: GUN STICK FIRES
Our little trick didn’t stop them for long.
I’m surprised it stopped them at all. These Daleks seem worn down, below par...
DALEK #2: Obey the Daleks!
FX: GUN STICK FIRES
(GASPS) You’d hardly know. That was too close.
Almost there! Faster!
FX: THEY SPRINT, DOCTOR UNLOCKS TARDIS
Key in the lock... and in!
DALEK #2: Exterminate.
FX: GUN STICK FIRES; SIMULTANEOUSLY, TARDIS DOOR SLAMS
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 51
27. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
FX: DOORS CLOSING
I’1ll programme Nyssa’s last known location into the flight computer and hope for the best.
You can’t steer your ship?
She has her moods. (FX: CONSOLE BUTTON-PRESSING) Come on, old girl. Look for an infra-red reading close to these co- ordinates...
FX: DEMATERIALISATION/TARDIS INTERIOR IN FLIGHT
I’ve got to get a message to the Empire. Daleks, here, on the fringes of our space!
I don’t think humanity’s their target. This is a small enclave, in deep cover, obsessed with the war against the Movellans. A war they don’t even know is over.
Or they refuse to accept that it is. Like they refuse to accept responsibility for destroying those planets.
And now their ‘process’ has been perfected, they’re ready to acts
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 52
28. DALEK CONTROL ROOM
FX: DALEK HEARTBEAT SOUND & HATCHING TANKS
FX: DOOR OPENS, DALEK #2 TALKS WITH DALEK #3
DALEK #2: The humanoids have escaped inside an alien artefact.
DALEK #3: A TARDIS. The male intruder is the Doctor.
DALEK #2: Doctor...?
DALEK #3: The greatest enemy of the Daleks. He has travelled to Traxana. He seeks to stop our work.
DALEK #2: The chronoplasms are almost in position. The Daleks’ triumph is inevitable.
DALEK #3:
Then our cover shall be broken. I shall inform the council of Skaro. The defeats of the past will be avenged. The new Dalek Age will begin.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 53
29. INT: MINE ON TRAXANA — NEAR PRECIPICE
FX: TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOORS OPEN
(EXITING) This is Traxana?
At the exact co-ordinates worked out by Elthar.
(OFF) What in the hel11...?
Doctor, look!
Ah! Hello, I didn’t see you behind the rocks.
(SOTTO) She’s a native?
(SOTTO) So it seems.
That box, it just appeared out— [of nowhere]
(IMPATIENT) Yes, yes, I know. Please, have you seen my friend Nyssa? Dark curly hair and terribly nice.
(SCARED) Then it was all real? You’re her doctor...?
I’m the Doctor, this is Sonderal. (BEAT) You’ve met Nyssa?
Doctor, she’s holding a gun.
Damn right I am. I don’t know what in hell is happening today but that mine shaft’s big enough for any number of bodies, so don’t—— AAAGGHH!
FX: SONDERAL’S GUN FIRES. THEEBE COLLAPSES
Greetings from planet Earth. My gun’s bigger than yours.
#224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 54
(SARCASTIC) A pithy summation of Earth Empire foreign policy, Sonderal, but she can’t tell us much while lying unconscious! She’s clearly met Nyssa, but — [we don’t know]
(OFF) Yes, and she tried to kill me.
(SPINS ROUND) Nyssa! There you are. Are you all right?
All right? She’s floating in mid-air above a mine shaft, Doctor!
Theebe there threw me off the precipice but the technology detected my fall. It caught me.
A gravity lift? Well, well. Nyssa, this is Sonderal.
I’m pleased to meet you.
I can’t honestly say I’m pleased about anything right now.
Be pleased you won’t have to take the steps. Room for two more in the gravity lift, Nyssa? (HE JUMPS IN) So there is.
There’s a vast excavation work beneath the crust of Traxana. You must see the scale of it all. The cell-spiders are being controlled and guided.
Yes. By the Daleks.
The Daleks?! The Daleks are here?

NYSSA: The mine is a convenient start point for the cell-spiders since it extends so deeply into Traxana’s crust. Now they’ve burrowed deeper still, until their tunnels connect all the way around the planet.
THEEBE: That’s impossible.
NYSSA: It’s incredible, but it’s fact. Don’t waste time asking how. What we need to know is why.
THEEBE: That’s what you need to know, not me. I just want them out of this mine. And since your blasting packs are primed to detonate on impact — you can take the quick way down.
NYSSA: (GRAPPLING) Theebe, get off me!
THEEBE: No-one’s gonna miss you, are they? The space girl who knew too much.
NYSSA: Please, you don’t have to do this.
THEEBE: After all I’ve done..? This is nothing.
NYSSA: <SCREAMS AS SHE GOES OVER THE PRECIPICE>
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 47
SONDERAL: (WHISPERS) Doctor, I know my history, I know about the Daleks. We’re dead, aren’t we?
DOCTOR: Not yet, Sonderal.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: Be silent.
SCION: <AGGRESSIVE CHITTERS>
SCION: DALEK #1: The first of the Scion Primes is dying.
DOCTOR: Scion Prime? You mean to say it’s a descendant of yours? Yes, of course, like the cell-spiders — formed from Dalek DNA.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: You are responsible for its condition.
DOCTOR: No. Your pet multipeds did it while attempting to repair your secret transmat station.
SONDERAL: Daleks invading an Earth Empire military outpost — that could be construed as an act of war.
SONDERAL: DALEK #1: Alien frontiers mean nothing to the Daleks.
DOCTOR: Except in so much as their bases offer you a place from which to aim your attacks in secret.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Inspect the matter transmitter.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: I obey.
DOCTOR: Attacks that removed whole planets from the fabric of the universe! Felkanto, Ottonius, all of them. You’re responsible for the slaughter and desecration of billions of lives!!
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Your views are unimportant.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 48
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: Matter transmitter non-functional.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: The matter transmitter must be restored.
DOCTOR: I couldn’t agree more. (BEAT) You know, I didn’t suspect your involvement, despite your striking at the fifth dimension as well as the fourth. Daleks kill with surgical precision — why would you seek to leave a thirty-year trail of anomalous vandalism behind you? To place blame on others?
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: The destruction of the planets was not intentional.
DOCTOR: What...?
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Do not advise him! He is a Movellan spy!
SONDERAL: (ASIDE) Movellan?
DOCTOR: (ASIDE) A robotic race, the Daleks’ archenemies for a time.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: For all time!
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: All Movellans and their agents will be exterminated.
DOCTOR: The Movellans left this sector of space almost a century ago — after crushing your forces.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: You lie. You seek to avert the final Dalek victory!
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: We are ready to act. The process has been perfected.
DOCTOR: What “process”?
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: The matter transmitter must be restored. Exterminate the intruders.
DOCTOR: Wait! We can help you. We’re humanoids with flexible digits fitted to the task, we’ll be faster than you.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 49
SONDERAL: I’1l summon my technical team at once... on the intercom.
DOCTOR: (WITH MEANING) Yes. Be sure to call them on full volume.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: Auditory circuits overloading.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: (AFFECTED) Ex-ter-min-ate!
DOCTOR: Run, Sonderal!
DOCTOR: (FX: AS DOCTOR AND SONDERAL RUN FROM ROOM — DALEK RAY GUN AND IMPACT. NOISE DIES AWAY)
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Intruders escaping! (SPEEDS AWAY) Pursuit mode engaged.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: I will restore the matter transmitter.
SCION: <WEAK CHITTERS>
SCION: DALEK #1: You have failed the Daleks. You have failed .. me. (PAUSE)
SCION: Exterminate.
SCION: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 50
SONDERAL: All right, Doctor, what now?
DOCTOR: Back to the TARDIS.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Halt! You will be exterminated.
SONDERAL: Our little trick didn’t stop them for long.
DOCTOR: I’m surprised it stopped them at all. These Daleks seem worn down, below par...
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Obey the Daleks!
SONDERAL: (GASPS) You’d hardly know. That was too close.
DOCTOR: Almost there! Faster!
DOCTOR: Key in the lock... and in!
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Exterminate.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 51
DOCTOR: I’1ll programme Nyssa’s last known location into the flight computer and hope for the best.
SONDERAL: You can’t steer your ship?
DOCTOR: She has her moods. (FX: CONSOLE BUTTON-PRESSING) Come on, old girl. Look for an infra-red reading close to these co- ordinates...
SONDERAL: I’ve got to get a message to the Empire. Daleks, here, on the fringes of our space!
DOCTOR: I don’t think humanity’s their target. This is a small enclave, in deep cover, obsessed with the war against the Movellans. A war they don’t even know is over.
SONDERAL: Or they refuse to accept that it is. Like they refuse to accept responsibility for destroying those planets.
DOCTOR: And now their ‘process’ has been perfected, they’re ready to acts
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 52
DOCTOR: 28. DALEK CONTROL ROOM
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: The humanoids have escaped inside an alien artefact.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: A TARDIS. The male intruder is the Doctor.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Doctor...?
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: The greatest enemy of the Daleks. He has travelled to Traxana. He seeks to stop our work.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: The chronoplasms are almost in position. The Daleks’ triumph is inevitable.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3:
DOCTOR: Then our cover shall be broken. I shall inform the council of Skaro. The defeats of the past will be avenged. The new Dalek Age will begin.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 53
SONDERAL: (EXITING) This is Traxana?
DOCTOR: At the exact co-ordinates worked out by Elthar.
THEEBE: (OFF) What in the hel11...?
SONDERAL: Doctor, look!
DOCTOR: Ah! Hello, I didn’t see you behind the rocks.
SONDERAL: (SOTTO) She’s a native?
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) So it seems.
THEEBE: That box, it just appeared out— [of nowhere]
DOCTOR: (IMPATIENT) Yes, yes, I know. Please, have you seen my friend Nyssa? Dark curly hair and terribly nice.
THEEBE: (SCARED) Then it was all real? You’re her doctor...?
DOCTOR: I’m the Doctor, this is Sonderal. (BEAT) You’ve met Nyssa?
SONDERAL: Doctor, she’s holding a gun.
THEEBE: Damn right I am. I don’t know what in hell is happening today but that mine shaft’s big enough for any number of bodies, so don’t—— AAAGGHH!
SONDERAL: Greetings from planet Earth. My gun’s bigger than yours.
SONDERAL: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 54
DOCTOR: (SARCASTIC) A pithy summation of Earth Empire foreign policy, Sonderal, but she can’t tell us much while lying unconscious! She’s clearly met Nyssa, but — [we don’t know]
NYSSA: (OFF) Yes, and she tried to kill me.
DOCTOR: (SPINS ROUND) Nyssa! There you are. Are you all right?
SONDERAL: All right? She’s floating in mid-air above a mine shaft, Doctor!
NYSSA: Theebe there threw me off the precipice but the technology detected my fall. It caught me.
DOCTOR: A gravity lift? Well, well. Nyssa, this is Sonderal.
NYSSA: I’m pleased to meet you.
SONDERAL: I can’t honestly say I’m pleased about anything right now.
DOCTOR: Be pleased you won’t have to take the steps. Room for two more in the gravity lift, Nyssa? (HE JUMPS IN) So there is.
NYSSA: There’s a vast excavation work beneath the crust of Traxana. You must see the scale of it all. The cell-spiders are being controlled and guided.
SONDERAL: Yes. By the Daleks.
NYSSA: The Daleks?! The Daleks are here?
DOCTOR: A scientific splinter group. They must be responsible for this lift, as well as spawning the cell-spiders. Jump in, Sonderal. We can share notes on the way down.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 55
DOCTOR: 30. DALEK CONTROL ROOM
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Report.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: (D) Matter transmitter restored to normal function.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Proceed to Traxana. Find and exterminate all who would interfere with the Dalek plan.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: The Scion Primes will follow you.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: (D) I obey.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Critical mass will be achieved when the last of the scions has
DOCTOR: Spawned and been placed in position. Open your casing.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: I concur.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: I will extract the necessary tissue.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: <SCREAMS>
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 56
DOCTOR: 31. DESCENDING MINE SHAFT
SONDERAL: My ears must have popped fifty times. How far down are we?
NYSSA: Miles by my calculations.
DOCTOR: What do you make of the green luminescence down here, Nyssa...
NYSSA: Slime trails of the cell-spiders, I think.
SONDERAL: Delicious. (BEAT) What’s that grey thing below us?
NYSSA: A backpack, full of explosives. Theebe threw me down here to set them off. She thought they would close up the mine. But she was mistaken.
DOCTOR: End of the line.
SONDERAL: (STARTS OFF) Finally!
NYSSA: Don’t touch the backpack, Sonderal. I don’t know how stable those explosives are.
DOCTOR: This way, into the cavern.
DOCTOR: [THEY WALK INTO NEXT SCENE: ]
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 57
DOCTOR: 32. GIANT CAVERN [CONTINUOUS]
SONDERAL: It’s vast!
NYSSA: It’s part of a gigantic passageway encircling Traxana’s core.
DOCTOR: Dalek engineering, impressive as ever.
SONDERAL: You'd need a thousand backpacks full of explosives to come close to caving in these works. Look at those cell-spiders, hunched up on the ledges.
NYSSA: It’s as if they’ve crawled into set positions. But do you notice the empty space in the design?
DOCTOR: Yes. As if awaiting the arrival of the hive leader...
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: You are correct.
NYSSA: A Dalek!
SONDERAL: And it’s blocking the way back to the lift...
DOCTOR: (TO DALEK) So you repaired the transmat? Bravo. Now your scion primes can sally forth and take up their position.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: You will not interfere with the Dalek design.
DOCTOR: And what IS the Dalek design, hmm? Wanton celestial desecration??
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: Your words are emotive. The process needed to be tested. Now we have corrected our failures.
SONDERAL: And done what?
SONDERAL: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 58
SONDERAL: DALEK #1: The chronoplasms are infused with time technology. When the Scion Primes are in position they will activate the power of the swarm.
NYSSA: Using some form of aggregation pheromone?
DOCTOR: Like a signal, yes. And once your time-sensitive cell-spiders are all set, what then?
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: They will freeze time around the core of Traxana.
NYSSA: (GOBSMACKED) They’1l stop Traxana spinning on its axis??
SONDERAL: But Traxana’s like Earth, it spins through space at a thousand miles per hour. If that spin is stopped dead...
DOCTOR: Dead is the word. Traxana’s mass may be halted but its atmosphere will still be in motion. Thousand-mile-an-hour winds will scour the landmasses down to the bedrock. Cities and wilderness alike, all life, will be literally blown away — a blank slate ready for Dalek occupation.
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: All worlds will become Dalek worlds.
NYSSA: No!
NYSSA: DALEK #1: The process will not fail. The Daleks will will infest key strategic worlds throughout the galaxy. Movella. Earth.
SONDERAL: Look away, you two!
SONDERAL: DALEK #1: <SCREAMS AND DIES>
DOCTOR: Sonderal, that was appallingly dangerous! You had no way of knowing how much explosive was in that backpack.
SONDERAL: I saw my chance, I took it. What next?
SONDERAL: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 59
DOCTOR: The Scion Primes will soon be swarming through these caverns, ready to trigger the final pulse that will either stop this planet dead, or reduce it to so much anomalous rubble. We’ve got to get back to the moonbase and find a way to stop it!
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 60
DOCTOR: (FX: CONTROL ROOM HEARTBEAT & GROTESQUE HATCHINGS OF THE SCION PRIMES )
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Scion Prime accelerated evolution in progress.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: Injecting irradiated cells. Temporal programming achieved.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Open the hatching tank. Release the Scions.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: Matter transmitter prepared. Destinations set on automatic.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Once the Scions are in position, we shall send the activation Signal. The process will begin.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 61
DOCTOR: 34. DELETED
DOCTOR: (FX: TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOCTOR, NYSSA AND SONDERAL BURST FROM INSIDE. BATTLE STATIONS! )
NYSSA: We’re back where we started, on the moonbase.
SONDERAL: The cell-spiders came this way before.
DOCTOR: And with luck they will again. I’m going to use the TARDIS force field generator to extrude an energy barrier, try to trap them within it.
NYSSA: Will the force field be strong enough? How many scion primes are we talking about?
SONDERAL: Too many.
DOCTOR: I have to start work. Nyssa, you and Sonderal must put the transmat out of action. Sonderal, give me your communicator, you go and get Elthar’s. Keep in touch.
SONDERAL: (CALLS AFTER) I saw what happened to Elthar. If those monsters slip your force field they’1l simply reverse any damage we do!
NYSSA: Sonderal, we must try.
SONDERAL: This isn’t even an Empire world. My duty is t—[o]
NYSSA: Your duty is to life! There are billions of people living on Traxana.
SONDERAL: Like the charming Theebe?
NYSSA: Good or bad, no matter the cost, we can’t abandon them.
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 62
SONDERAL: The Doctor was right. You really are nice, aren’t you. (BEAT) You know, Theebe might be able to help us — especially if she’s still unconscious. Come on.
SONDERAL: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 63
SONDERAL: 36. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
DOCTOR: (FEVERISHLY, TO SELF) Force field generator couplings... there. Reconfigure the outflow through the extrusion array...
DOCTOR: Here they come. (FX: FLIPS COMMUNICATOR) Nyssa, Sonderal, have you reached the transmat?
NYSSA: (COMMS) Yes. But we haven’t disabled it yet. Sonderal had an idea [that—]
DOCTOR: The scions are almost on me. Here goes. In three, two, one—
SCION PRIMES: <BLOODTHIRSTY SHRIEKS>
NYSSA: (COMMS) Did it work? Doctor?
DOCTOR: Yes, they’re caught in the TARDIS forcefield. Now, if I can calculate the range of enclosure required, take off with them and rematerialize in space...
DOCTOR: Oh, no.
NYSSA: (COMMS) Doctor?
DOCTOR: There must be over a hundred scions trying to break through. And like the cell-spiders they generate time spillage. Entropy and renewal, accelerating through the TARDIS systems. The console can’t contain it!!!
NYSSA: (COMMS) Doctor, get out of there!
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 64
NYSSA: DALEK #3: Detectors show Scion Prime progress no longer halted by force field.
NYSSA: DALEK #2: The Doctor has failed. Prime units now proceeding to transmat area.
NYSSA: DALEK #3: Alert! Sensors detect humans in proximity.
NYSSA: DALEK #2:
NYSSA: I shall exterminate them. Distribution of Scion Primes must proceed as planned. You will remain here and prepare to send activation signal.
NYSSA: DALEK #3: I obey.
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 65
SONDERAL: The way those things just wait in line to be transported - it’s eerie.
NYSSA: It’s programming. These creatures have no free will. They were bred for one purpose.
SONDERAL: Let’s just hope our plan works better than the Doctor’s did.
NYSSA: I hope he’s all right. That it was just the comms cut out.
SONDERAL: So do I. Without him I don’t know how we can find the Daleks’ control centre and stop that signal [before...]
SONDERAL: DALEK #2: Do not move.
NYSSA: Too late. They’ve found us.
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 66
THEEBE: Uhhh... what the hell hit me? [Never seen a gun like —]
THEEBE: What’s that? — Spiders!
THEEBE: But they were never that big...!
SCION PRIME: <BELLOWED ROAR>
THEEBE: Explosives. Where’s my backpack? (REALISATION) Someone’s stolen my backpack!
THEEBE: Back! Get back! The tunnel’s not wide enough, you’re gonna
THEEBE: trample meeeeeee—!
THEEBE: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 67
THEEBE: DALEK #2: Your sabotage has failed. When the Scion Primes are in position the signal will be activated.
NYSSA: And the process will begin.
SONDERAL: Traxana stops spinning.
DOCTOR: (CALLS) Speaking of spin, I was once up against the cricketer Wilfred Rhodes. Best left-arm spinner I ever met.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Doctor!!
DOCTOR: After me, that is. (HE BOWLS) Down, you two!
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Extermin-AAAAAAAAAAGH
NYSSA: Doctor!
DOCTOR: Hmm, shooting a blasting pack in mid-air: excellent aim, questionable judgement. You’re both unharmed?
SONDERAL: Just about. Which is more than you can say for the transmat now.
NYSSA: You took the leftover explosive from the backpack outside?
DOCTOR: Yes. I take it you’ve been back to Traxana...?
NYSSA: The co-ordinates were already programmed. I sent Sonderal across...
SONDERAL: I helped myself to Theebe’s pack, and Nyssa brought me back — in time to attach timed explosive charges to the scions.
SONDERAL: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 68
DOCTOR: They didn’t realise?
NYSSA: The cell-spiders were so sticky they dragged me away with one touch. The scions are more glutinous still.
DOCTOR: Yes, well, that’s very — enterprising of you both. Where’s Theebe now?
NYSSA: Still unconscious. Don’t worry, I told Sonderal to move her out of the scions’ path. (CONCERN) You did move her like I said, didn’t you, [Sonderal? ]
SONDERAL: (TOO QUICKLY — SHE’S LYING) Yes, of course. (CHANGING THE SUBJECT) Anyway — we’ve got about fifteen minutes ‘til the charges detonate.
NYSSA: With all the Scion Primes blown to bits, the cell-spiders won’t receive the pheremone trigger, and the process can’t be completed.
DOCTOR: Except there’s one last Dalek still at large. If it triggers the activation signal before the Scions detonate...
SONDERAL: Then it’1ll all have been for nothing.
DOCTOR: (RUNS FROM ROOM) Come on!
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 69
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: Control to transmat.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3:
DOCTOR: Contact lost. (FX: OPERATES CONTROLS) Traxana scan shows Scion Primes nearing final positions. Signal to be transmitted in ten... nine... eight...
DOCTOR: Stop! You will not activate that signal.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: Exterminate!
DOCTOR: That won’t work. I’m holding the TARDIS’s force field generator.
NYSSA: We collected it on our way here.
DOCTOR: It was thrown clear when the console blew. Protected by its own force field.
SONDERAL: Now it’s protecting us too.
DOCTOR: So if I step in the way of your controls, you can’t reach them through the barrier.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: Scions in position. The signal will be activated. I will burn through your barrier.
DOCTOR: You’re not strong enough!
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: Maximum charge.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL)
NYSSA: Doctor, its casing, it’s shaking.
SONDERAL: What’s it doing?
DOCTOR: Channelling every last scintilla of a final blast.
NYSSA: Will the barrier hold?
NYSSA: DALEK #3: (STRAINED, RISING) Exterminate.
NYSSA: Page 70
NYSSA: energy into its weapon
DOCTOR: The force field’s collapsing!!
SONDERAL: Then we’re finished...!
SONDERAL: (FX: SERIES OF EXPLOSIONS. COMMS: SCREECHES OF DYING CELL-
SONDERAL: SPIDERS )
NYSSA: Doctor, look - the monitors.
DOCTOR: (DAZED) The Scion Primes...
NYSSA: They’re going up in flames! The timers have counted down!
NYSSA: DALEK #3:
NYSSA: (SLUGGISH) No! Activate signal. Activate signal.
DOCTOR: for
DOCTOR: You're too late, Dalek. And it looks to me as if you’ve used
DOCTOR: the last of your power.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: (DYING) Doctor... will pay.
DOCTOR: The force-field generator’s run down. Go ahead, do your worst.
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: EX... ext...
DOCTOR: You haven’t the energy to exterminate an earwig.
DOCTOR: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL)
DOCTOR: DALEK #3: Ex- eX — ex...
SONDERAL: Is it dead?
NYSSA: Yes. It’s over.
NYSSA: Page 71
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 72
SONDERAL: You don’t have to walk me to the landing bay, you know. I can find my ship.
NYSSA: You’11 contact your Empire and make a full report?
DOCTOR: In triplicate, I dare say.
SONDERAL: Speaking of my report: I know the scions were destroyed, but the majority of the cell-spiders on Traxana must have survived?
DOCTOR: Best to leave out all mention of them. We don’t want Earth’s military chasing after that kind of technology.
SONDERAL: No.
NYSSA: The spiders will die out in time. Still waiting for a signal that will never come. I hope Theebe leaves them well alone... and that her crimes come to light.
SONDERAL: Well, you know... what goes around, comes around. (CHANGING SUBJECT) And what about you two? That crazy blue box of yours is a mess.
NYSSA: The console overloaded. It’1ll take days to repair.
DOCTOR: Well, we’ve nothing pressing. Although I was thinking we could catch the Australian tour of England in 1902...
NYSSA: Is that more cricket?
SONDERAL: Take your time on those repairs, Doctor. For her sake. (BEAT) Well, here’s the launch bay. Time to go.
NYSSA: Goodbye, Sonderal.
NYSSA: #224a: ALIEN HEART by Stephen Cole (FINAL) Page 73
DOCTOR: Safe travels.
SONDERAL: And to you. I’d say ‘See you again,’ [but —]
SONDERAL: AAAAAGHHHHH!!!
NYSSA: Doctor, she’s dead!
DOCTOR: More Daleks?!
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: Do not move!
DOCTOR: Do as they say, Nyssa.
DOCTOR: DALEK #2: Where is the enclave?
DOCTOR: DALEK #1: The enclave summoned a command ship.
NYSSA: So that’s where they’ve come from!
DOCTOR: (TO DALEK) I’m not sorry to say, the Dalek enclave has been destroyed. Now it’s my turn, I suppose?
NYSSA: Doctor, there must be something we can do?
NYSSA: DALEK #1: Escape is impossible. You are our prisoners! You are the prisoners of the Daleks!
NYSSA: [NB: STORY CONTINUES IN DALEK SOUL]
NYSSA: #224a: DALEK SOUL by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page /
DALEK SOUL: by Guy Adams
THE DOCTOR: PETER DAVISON Loyal supporter of the Daleks, cruel and sadistic.
NYSSA: SARAH SUTTON Chief virologist for the Daleks, confused and conflicted.
PRECUSO: (F, 40s) Assistant to Nyssa, a guilty collaborator.
FALEX: (also COMPUTER) (F, 20s-30s) Lieutenant in a rebel army.
TORU: (M, 40s-50s) Leader of the rebels [only ever heard through a voice filter].
THE DALEKS: NICHOLAS BRIGGS
ALSO: KRILLEM and SALDO [rebel prisoners].
DIRECTOR: KEN BENTLEY
SCRIPT EDITOR: ALAN BARNES
PRODUCER: DAVID RICHARDSON
EXECUTIVE PRODUCERS: NICHOLAS BRIGGS & JASON HAIGH-ELLERY

elements.text: PART ONE
1. INT. VIRAL RESEARCH LAB/TEST CUBICLE.
FX. DALEK PULSE. DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
DALEK #1:
Bring in the test subjects.
FX. TWO PRISONERS ARE ESCORTED IN BY A SECOND DALEK.
DALEK #2:
Move!!!
This is unacceptable! We are free citizens of Mojox. We’ve done nothing wrong!
(MOCKING) Yeah! — I mean, we may have blown up the odd Dalek transmitter but who hasn’t?
(HISSED) Shut up, Saldo!
Save your breath, Krillem. There’s no going back. They’d kill you even if they thought you were innocent. Which they don’t, obviously.
DALEK #2: Silence!
DALEK #1: Prisoners will enter the test cubicle.
FX. CUBICLE DOOR HISSES OPEN AND THE DALEK HERDS THEM IN. THE SECOND PRISONER STUMBLES SLIGHTLY.
(RESPONSE NOISE TO STUMBLING) Oof! Careful! Don’t want me to hurt myself now do you? (LAUGHS)
FX. WE CROSS TO INSIDE CUBICLE AS THE DOOR CLOSES ON THEM.
How can you be so.. amused by all this?
Oh, I’m not amused. I’m just tired. We’ve been fighting so long this is almost a relief.
#224a: DALEK SOUL by Guy Adams (FINAL) Page 3
I don’t want to die...
I don’t think you’ve got much say in the matter.
FX. A KLAXON SOUNDS OUTSIDE THE CUBICLE.
(PANIC BUILDING) What’s that? What’s happening?
Don’t know, maybe it’s starting.
What’s starting?
Whatever it is that’s going to kill us. (SNIFFS) Can you smell something? (SNIFFS) Sweet, like fried anjak.
